abstract: Prescient investors are sometimes referred to as oracles, but Jesse Bravo, an investment manager at EKN Financial, actually claims to be one. Mr. Bravo leads a weekly workshop for aspiring psychics called "Séance in the City," The Wall Street Journal reports. But despite the market advantages a third eye could bring, Mr. Bravo said he doesn't use his soothsaying talents at work. "The second you mix them up, you open a Pandora's box, and I don't know the price of that," he said.
